data.name: Looking Inside Cells Demo
data.detailed_description:
Looking Inside Cells is a set of interactive Virtual Reality simulations for learning about cellular biology. Users can build cells by arranging their organelles, as well as transform them into specialized cells, such as red blood cells and e. coli bacteria. This Virtual Reality experience is designed to increase students’ engagement and excitement for learning biology, and to bring out their naturally inquisitive nature.

Designed for Middle School students, but appropriate for anyone who wants to experience an interactive and unique view of cells.

IMPORTANT! This is a DEMO with limited access and only the single player mode. The full multiplayer version is FREE and includes additional simulations. Create a free account on the Verizon Innovative Learning HQ portal to get the full version and start building cells together today! The full list of learning objectives and accompanying materials are also available there. Click on the link to visit our website from this page to access it directly.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-4590 / AMD FX 8350 / or equivalent
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 970 / AMD RX 480 / or equivalent
  • Storage: 325 MB available space
